a gaming console Microsoft CEO Steve Ballmer was recently interviewed by USA Today. As usual, Steve Ballmer had some interesting things to say; here are what we consider the top three questions and answers: Q: You sold 8 million Kinects over the holidays, more than you expected. What differentiates it from other gaming consoles on the market? A: Xbox isn't a gaming console. Xbox is a family entertainment center. It's a place to socialize. It's a place to watch TV. and will assume the position of executive chief. On the official Google blog Eric Schmidt wrote that he, Page and co-founder Sergey Brin had decided it was time to make some structural changes to the company. This triumvirate approach has real benefits in terms of shared wisdom, and we will continue to discuss the big decisions among the three of us. But we have also agreed to clarify our individual roles so there's clear responsibility and accountability at the top of the company, wrote Eric Schmidt . He further discussed their roles, saying that Page would lead product development and technology strategy along with becoming the company's CEO. Sergey Brin will retain his title of co-founder and he will

they will make their decisions soon. Representative Mike Pence of Indiana said last week that he would not run. Mitt Romney , a former Massachusetts governor, is not expected to announce any plans until the spring. One of the lessons that Mitt Romney learned from the last campaign is that things got started too soon, said Mitt Romney spokesman Eric Fehrnstrom . "He's in no hurry to announce his plans."
